definition: to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
(idiom) ignore your elders at your peril
pinyin: bu4 ting1 lao3 ren2 yan2 , chi1 kui1 zai4 yan3 qian2
containing_words.word: 不听老人言，吃亏在眼前

definition: to be taken advantage of
see 貨比三家不吃虧|货比三家不吃亏[huo4 bi3 san1 jia1 bu4 chi1 kui1]
pinyin: huo4 wen4 san1 jia1 bu4 chi1 kui1

definition: shop around first and you won't get ripped off (idiom)
pinyin: huo4 bi3 san1 jia1 bu4 chi1 kui1

sentences.english: A bad compromise is better than a good suit.
sentences.chinese: 吃亏的和解强似胜利的诉讼。

sentences.english: But if doing so you certainly suffered loses.
sentences.chinese: 当然这样很吃亏，假如你不想吃亏，就该去偷个汉来。

sentences.english: But if doing so you certainly suffered loses.
sentences.chinese: 当然这样很吃亏，假如你不想吃亏，就该去偷个汉来。

sentences.english: You will stand to lose if you do business with him.
sentences.chinese: 跟他作生意你是要吃亏的。

sentences.english: She knows that at all times heel firm the Feng dance, can't suffer a los.
sentences.chinese: 她知道，只要跟紧了凤舞，就不会吃亏。

sentences.english: Disadvantage is a blessing, Do not have too much gas.
sentences.chinese: 吃亏是福，不要生太大的气。

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth like this , it is you who will suffer at last.
sentences.chinese: 你这样打肿脸充胖子，到最后只能自己吃亏。

sentences.english: The lei smell speech her dont easy to DE shi change immediately, lest suffer.
sentences.chinese: 亚磊闻言立即着她别容易对德仕改观，免得吃亏。

sentences.english: Will England lose on penalties again this time?
sentences.chinese: 这次英格兰还会在点球上吃亏吗？

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth, you' ll suffer.
sentences.chinese: 打肿脸充胖子，吃亏是自己。

sentences.english: Women have lost out in this new pay flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 在这一新的薪资弹性化政策中吃亏的是女性。

sentences.english: why do ye not rather suffer yourselves to be defrauded?
If do not include the allowance of Chinese government, the deficit of core international is met in bigger.
sentences.chinese: 假如不包括中国政府的津贴，中芯国际的吃亏会更大。

definition: to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to be taken advantage of
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to meet force with force/painstaking
to be forced to suffer in silence/unable to speak of one's bitter suffering
to lose face
to predominate/to occupy a dominant position
convenient
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
honest/sincere/well-behaved/open and guileless/naive
otherwise/or else/or
